thread.title: Brexit: If there was another referendum how would you vote? Geordies have their say

author: Mike Fuller
title: Brexit: If there was another referendum how would you vote? Geordies have their say
text:

Brexit is a topic which splits the opinions of families and friends. 
The UK’s departure from the European Union is never far from the headlines, but it has been on the front pages again this week. 
Leaked Government analysis suggests the North East economy will be hit hardest by Brexit . We asked people on the streets of Newcastle about Brexit. Clockwise: Margaret and John Quinn, Bob Langley, Sophie Walker and Brian Paterson (Image: Trinity Mirror) 
The report shows the impact of leaving the EU over 15 years compared to what would happen to the UK economy if Brexit did not take place. 
The region’s GDP is predicted to shrink by 11% even if there is a comprehensive trade deal. 
If there is no deal at all this could be a 16% decline, the report says. 
We spoke to people on the streets of Newcastle to get their opinions. 
Take a look at what they had to say in the video above. Read More 'Don't take us for idiots': North East business leader reacts to Brexit impact figures 
Bob Langley, 81, from Whitley Bay, voted to leave but thought he may change his vote given another opportunity. 
He said: “Afterwards I thought about it and at my age I would have been far better off remaining with Europe.” 
Brian Paterson, 67, from Summerhill, was a supporter of Brexit and had not changed his mind. 
He said: “I would leave again and frankly I don’t see any huge difference.” 
Sophie Walker, 25, from Newcastle but who lives in Cardiff, voted to stay in the EU and said she would do again. 
She said: “I work in the NHS which will be heavily disadvantaged by Brexit.” Read More 
Husband and wife John and Margaret Quinn, 77 and 69, from Washington, voted to remain in 2015 but said the initial referendum result should be respected. 
Margaret said: “It’s done. Ordinary people just want to know directly how it will affect them.” Like us on Facebook
